  6. from .ftp import ftp_check
  7. from .repo import bitbucket_check
  8. from ftp_deploy.conf import *
  11. class service_check(object):
  13. """Service check class, what group together all checking points. Return 'fails' and 'message' lists"""
  15. def __init__(self, service):
  16. self.service = service
  17. self.message = list()
  18. self.fails = [False, False, False, False]
  20. def check_log(self):
  21. """Check logs"""
  22. if self.service.pk is not None:
  23. log_fail = self.service.log_set.all().filter(status=False).filter(skip=False).count()
  24. if log_fail:
  25. self.message.append('<b>Log</b>: Deploy Fails(%d)' % log_fail)
  26. self.fails[0] = True
  28. def check_repo(self):
  29. """Check repositories connection, along with POST Hook"""
  30. if self.service.repo_source == 'bb':
  31. bb = bitbucket_check(BITBUCKET_SETTINGS['username'], BITBUCKET_SETTINGS['password'], self.service)
  32. bb_fail, bb_fail_message = bb.check_all()
  34. if bb_fail:
  35. self.message.append(bb_fail_message)
  36. self.fails[1] = True
  38. hook_fail, hook_fail_message = bb.check_hook_exist()
  39. if hook_fail:
  40. self.message.append(hook_fail_message)
  41. self.fails[2] = True
  43. def check_ftp(self):
  44. """Check FTP connection"""
  45. ftp = ftp_check(self.service.ftp_host, self.service.ftp_username, self.service.ftp_password, self.service.ftp_path)
  46. ftp_fail, ftp_fail_message = ftp.check_all()
  47. ftp.quit()
  49. if ftp_fail:
  50. self.message.append(ftp_fail_message)
  51. self.fails[3] = True
  53. def check_all(self):
  54. self.check_log()
  55. self.check_repo()
  56. self.check_ftp()
  58. return self.fails, self.message
  61. class commits_parser(object):
  63. """Commit parser for list of commits. Take commits dictionary captured from payload"""
  65. def __init__(self, commits):
  66. self.commits = commits
  68. def commits_info(self):
  69. """Return commits details list in format [message,author,raw_node]"""
  70. output = list()
  71. [output.append([commit['message'], commit['author'], commit['raw_node']]) for commit in reversed(self.commits)]
  72. return output
  74. def email_list(self):
  75. """Return email list from raw_author, limited to unique emails"""
  76. output = list()
  77. for commit in self.commits:
  78. email = re.search('%s(.*)%s' % ('<', '>'), commit['raw_author']).group(1)
  79. output.append(email) if email not in output else False
  80. return output
  82. def file_diff(self):
  83. """Return files list grouped by added, modified and removed. Respect order of commits"""
  84. added, removed, modified = list(), list(), list()
  86. for commit in self.commits:
  87. for file in commit['files']:
  88. if file['type'] == 'added':
  89. added.append(file['file']) if file['file'] not in added else False
  90. removed.remove(file['file']) if file['file'] in removed else False
  91. elif file['type'] == 'modified':
  92. modified.append(file['file']) if file['file'] not in modified and file['file'] not in added else False
  93. elif file['type'] == 'removed':
  94. removed.append(file['file']) if file['file'] not in removed + added else False
  95. added.remove(file['file']) if file['file'] in added else False
  96. modified.remove(file['file']) if file['file'] in modified else False
  98. return added, modified, removed
  101. class absolute_url(object):
  103. """Build absolute url to root url whthout trailing slash"""
  105. def __init__(self, request):
  106. self.request = request
  108. def build(self):
  109. return self.request.build_absolute_uri('/')[:-1]
  112. class LockError(Exception):
  114. """Exception if service is locked"""
  116. def __str__(self):
  117. return 'Deploy failed because service is Locked!'
